intro: Blakea allotricha, commonly known as the silverleaf Blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that have a distinctive silver or whitish underside. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Blakea allotricha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
